Materials

class pyrit.material.Materials(*mats: Mat)

Bases: object

Class that manages materials of a problem

Constructor of Material

Parameters

*mats (Mat) – A number of Mats, possibly empty.

Return type

None.

Methods

add_material

Adds a number of Mats to Material.

delete_material

Deletes a number of Mats specified by thier IDs from Material

get_ids

Returns the IDs of all Mats saved in Material

get_material

Returns a number of Materials specified by their IDs

get_material_from_name

Get a specific Mat from its name.

get_material_id_from_name

Get the ID of a specific Mat from its name.

is_homogeneous

Returns if the material is homogeneous or not.

is_hysteretic

Returns if the material is hysteretic or not.

is_isotropic

Returns if the material is isotropic or not.

is_linear

Returns if the material is linear or not.

is_time_dependent

Returns if the material is time dependent or not.

update

Update a value in the materials.
add_material(*mats: Mat)

Adds a number of Mats to Material.

Parameters

*mats (Mat) – A number of Mats.

Return type

None.

delete_material(*IDs: int)

Deletes a number of Mats specified by thier IDs from Material

Parameters

*ids (int) – A number of IDs.

Return type

None.

get_material(mat_ID: int)

Returns a number of Materials specified by their IDs

Parameters

id (int) – An IDs.

Raises

KeyError – When the ID of the Mat is unknown.

Returns

A List of the Mats.

Return type

Mat

get_material_id_from_name(name: str) → int

Get the ID of a specific Mat from its name.

The ID of the first Mat with the given name is returned. If multiple Mat’s with the same name are present, a warning is given.

Parameters

name (str) – The name of the requested Mat

Returns

id – The id of the mat with the given name.

Return type

int

get_material_from_name(name: str) → Mat

Get a specific Mat from its name. The first Mat with the given name is returned.

Parameters

name (str) – The name of the requested Mat

Returns

mat – The mat with the given name.

Return type

Mat

get_ids()

Returns the IDs of all Mats saved in Material

Returns

A list with the IDs of all Mats saved in Material.

Return type

List[int]

is_linear(prop_class: Optional[Type[MatProperty]] = None) → bool

Returns if the material is linear or not.

Parameters

prop_class (Type[MatProperty], optional) – If given, it is only checked if the property of this type is linear. If not given, all properties are considered.

Returns

linear

Return type

bool

is_homogeneous(prop_class: Optional[Type[MatProperty]] = None) → bool

Returns if the material is homogeneous or not.

Parameters

prop_class (Type[MatProperty], optional) – If given, it is only checked if the property of this type is homogeneous. If not given, all properties are considered.

Returns

homogeneous

Return type

bool

is_isotropic(prop_class: Optional[Type[MatProperty]] = None) → bool

Returns if the material is isotropic or not.

Parameters

prop_class (Type[MatProperty], optional) – If given, it is only checked if the property of this type is isotropic. If not given, all properties are considered.

Returns

isotropic

Return type

bool

is_hysteretic(prop_class: Optional[Type[MatProperty]] = None) → bool

Returns if the material is hysteretic or not.

Parameters

prop_class (Type[MatProperty], optional) – If given, it is only checked if the property of this type is hysteretic. If not given, all properties are considered.

Returns

hysteretic

Return type

bool

is_time_dependent(prop_class: Optional[Type[MatProperty]] = None) → bool

Returns if the material is time dependent or not.

Parameters

prop_class (Type[MatProperty], optional) – If given, it is only checked if the property of this type is time dependent. If not given, all properties are considered.

Returns

hysteretic

Return type

bool

update(name: str, val: Any, *, materials: Optional[Iterable] = None, prop_class: Optional[Type[MatProperty]] = None)

Update a value in the materials.

Parameters

  • name (str) – Name of the argument in the MatProperties to update.

  • val (Any) – The new value that is written on the MatProperties

  • materials (Iterable, optional) – Iterable of materials to update values in. It can be integers (ID) or strings (material name)

  • prop_class (Type[MatProperty], optional) – If given, set the value only in the MatProperty of given type. If not given, set the value for all. Default is None
